meanings.definition: Not wise or prudent; lacking in political acumen.
meanings.sent1: Her impolitical decision led to serious consequences.
meanings.sent2: The impolitical move cost him the election.
meanings.sent3: It was impolitical of him to ignore all advice.
meanings.sent4: His impolitical choices left him isolated in the political arena.
meanings.sent5: The impolitical strategy proved to be a disaster.

meanings.definition: Not suitable for political purposes; not in accordance with political principles.
meanings.sent1: The impolitical speech did not resonate with the voters.
meanings.sent2: His impolitical behavior alienated his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: It seemed impolitical to bring up personal matters in the debate.
meanings.sent4: The impolitical decision went against all political norms.
meanings.sent5: Her impolitical stance was met with criticism from all sides.

meanings.definition: Lacking in tact or diplomacy; not showing good manners or etiquette.
meanings.sent1: His impolitical comments offended everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The impolitical remark created an awkward atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: It was impolitical to speak out of turn during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The impolitical behavior embarrassed his guests.
meanings.sent5: Her impolitical attitude made her unpopular among her peers.
